page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: THIS IS A RURAL AREA. BENINGBROUGH HALL AND PARK, OWNED BY THE NATIONAL TRUST,FILLS THE N.E. CORNER, ISOLATED FROM THE REST OF THE BLOCK BY THE RIVER OUSE. THE NEAREST RIVER CROSSINGS ENTAIL JOURNEYS OF 20 MILES TO REACH THE VILLAGES OF NUN MONKTON AND MOOR MONKTON TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. THE RIVER NIDD SEPARATES THESE TWO VILLAGES MEANDERING IN LARGE LOOPS,AND JOINS THE OUSE AT NUN MONKTON. THESE SMALL COMMUNITIES LOOK TO YORK AND HARROGATE FOR URBAN AMENITIES AND EMPLOYMENT FOR MOST OF THE WORKING POPULATION. AGRICULTURAL LAND DOMINATES THE LANDSCAPE BUT NOW PROVIDES WORK FOR A MINORITY OF PEOPLE. MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY ENJOY COUNTRY LIFE AND RURAL PURSUITS. TOURISTS VISIT BENINGBROUGH AND THE RIVERS ATTRACT ANGLERS AND BOAT OWNERS.
